title: Is systems thinking a skill? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would say that it is a skill. First, it is a theory . Once you understand the theory you can begin to use it to identify real life situations in which the theory seems to apply. The more you do this, the easier it becomes for you . You will be able to perceive insights in Social functioning of groups, organizations , etc. In ways others cannot . Yet, it is a theory , a mental representation of reality , so, do social systems really exist ? The frustration comes when you clearly understand a dynamic and its consequential implications but every non-trained person around you remains oblivious and highly doubtful about your supposed insight .

If a skill is something that person can learn and get better and better at by practice, then yes: Systems thinking is a skill. Note: I’m speaking of systems thinking as the skill of thinking about (and representing) things in terms of feedback loops. None of the prior comments apply to this viewpoint except for Brian Van Dine’s.
